Certainly a game that has had it's ups and downs over the years, I've been playing on and off since a bit before the huntress came out, (a few years back, I'm sorta a veteran player?) if you're taking the time to read this I assume you know the basics of dead by daylight, a multiplayer horror game (loosely horror, can be scary though) where four survivors work together towards and objective which allows them to escape the killer, the killer makes an effort to interrupt the net survivor progress and place them on hooks to sacrifice them to the entity, a god which manipulates the game. Dead by daylight is a very fun, sometimes very tilting game, you know how some people have a game as their "main game", like you'll have someone who mostly plays league of legends, or someone who mostly plays a shooter like COD or fortnite, dead by daylight is a game with the potential to be a "main game", in depth gameplay, every trial (match) has the potential to be wildly different from the last, the game has wildly improved over the years, it still has some bugs, but the fixes have been exponential, plus a recent graphical update, I'd say now is a decent time to play dead by daylight, crossplay and some high profile DLCs (stranger things, Silent Hill) have attracted a decent player base, honestly I don't know if I can drop some profound line which will make you buy the game, but it's absolutely one of a kind, I suggest you watch some videos on the game, in my opinion Otzdarva is a great starting point, tutorials, super wholesome, very talented player ;^)

I First saw H2O Delirious play this game on YouTube and I fell in love with the amount of adrenaline that builds up in the game.
This game is great to play with a group of people as it allows you to learn how to co-op together as survivors and keeps you on your toes when the killer is nearby.

I love this Game and will recommend this game to anyone looking to play with a group of friends or people.
